website_summaries.verdict: The top name in keeping hot drinks hot and cold drinks cold comes through with a stylish tumbler that holds a super-sized frosty drink.
pros: Mug is BPA-free, and safe for freezer, microwave, and dishwasher
Comes with a cover to prevent spills, especially helpful when traveling
Users feel that beverages definitely stay colder than with other brands
Fun design makes it look like you’re always drinking a beer
cons: Price point may be a little on the high end for someone not familiar with the brand

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tervis Tumbler 🍺
customer_reviews.text: I love my 24oz Tervis Frosty Brew Tumbler! I drink a lot of carbonated water and the bubbles in the water make the translucent wrap on this tumbler look even more realistic! I also use glass straws and was pleased that my 9”x10mm glass straws fit perfectly through the opening in the lid. I’ve added two photos to show the translucency and how well the top accommodates my straw. The ice looks a bit strange because of how the wrap is colored but the bubbles from the carbonated water sticking to my straw also adds to the look of having a frosty brew without the hangover 😁.
customer_reviews.author: Célestine

customer_reviews.title: You can make someone's day.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for someone that could not have this drink because of his cancer treatment. He told friends and family to send him a beer. This looks so real and he was so excited to receive this glass. I was Thanked in his Caring Bridge writings and a special note.
customer_reviews.author: Kh

customer_reviews.title: Great Tumbler with an incorrect description
customer_reviews.text: Looks very realistic. Typical Tervis quality and attention to detail. Definitely needs the clear travel lid, but it does NOT come with the lid, contrary to what the item title/description says. All you get is the Tumbler. The lids are readily available at many stores for $4 or direct from Tervis. The frosted/clear lid looks best, but a white lid would be fine too. I tried a yellow lid and it looked bad. Add a Tervis handle and you have a great Oktoberfest beer mug.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bob
